page.title: 15DALRY RELIGION
page.content: Half of Dalry's population are Church members, with a committed adult Christian population of over 2300. The{Church of Scotland}has two Churches. St. Margaret's, whose spire dominates the town centre, has over 1700 members, with 1200 communicants. Trinity's membership is about 600. About 550{Roman Catholics,}with the Church of St. Palladius, are served by an Irish priest. There are also two {Gospel Halls}and a small{Episcopalian Church. Relations between the Churches are good, with little evidence of bigotry. All come together sometimes to worship in inter-church services. Many organisations are linked to the churches eg. women's guilds, youth clubs, Boy's Brigade. Most marriages are religious services and almost all funerals are conducted by ministers of religion.
